flawed_nl_solution:
Earl will have $90 - $28 = $<<90-28=63>>63 after paying off his debt to Fred.
Fred will have $48 + $28 = $<<48+28=76>>76 after being paid by Earl.
But then Fred will have $76 - $32 = $<<76-32=44>>44 after paying Greg.
Greg will have $36 + $32 = $<<36+32=68>>68 after Fred paid him.
Then, Greg will have $68 - $40 = $<<68-40=28>>28 after paying off his debt to Earl.
Then, Earl will then have $63 + $40 = $<<63+40=103>>103.
So together, Greg and Earl will have $28 + $103 = $<<28+103=131>>131.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 62, not 63. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
